description:
Microsoft says the Midnight Blizzard APT group may still be poking around its internal network after stealing source code, spying on emails.

The post Microsoft Says Russian Gov Hackers Stole Source Code After Spying on Executive Emails appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Microsoft Says Russian Gov Hackers Stole Source Code After Spying on Executive Emails

description:
Concluding a two-day OSS security summit, CISA details key actions to help improve open source security.

The post CISA Outlines Efforts to Secure Open Source Software appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: CISA Outlines Efforts to Secure Open Source Software

description:
California startup banks $20 million Series A financing for technology to help businesses manage the maze of security tools and products.

The post Reach Security Raises $20M to Help Manage Cybersecurity Products appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Reach Security Raises $20M to Help Manage Cybersecurity Products

description:
Sapphire Ventures and Ansa Capital have invested $35 million in national security systems software startup Defense Unicorns.

The post Defense Unicorns Raises $35 Million for National Security Software Solutions appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Defense Unicorns Raises $35 Million for National Security Software Solutions

description:
Noteworthy stories that might have slipped under the radar: Google AI bug bounties, font vulnerabilities, IBM opens new training facility.

The post In Other News: Google AI Hacking, Font Vulnerabilities, IBM Training Facility appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: In Other News: Google AI Hacking, Font Vulnerabilities, IBM Training Facility

description:
Change Healthcare says it has made significant progress in restoring systems impacted by a recent ransomware attack.

The post Change Healthcare Restores Pharmacy Services Disrupted by Ransomware appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Change Healthcare Restores Pharmacy Services Disrupted by Ransomware

description:
Chinese APT Evasive Panda compromises a software developer’s supply chain to target Tibetans with malicious downloaders.

The post Chinese Cyberspies Target Tibetans via Watering Hole, Supply Chain Attacks appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Chinese Cyberspies Target Tibetans via Watering Hole, Supply Chain Attacks

description:
Multiple vulnerabilities in Sceiner firmware allow attackers to compromise smart locks and open doors.

The post Unpatched Sceiner Smart Lock Vulnerabilities Allow Hackers to Open Doors appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Unpatched Sceiner Smart Lock Vulnerabilities Allow Hackers to Open Doors

description:
A group of 40 state attorneys general have sent a letter to Meta expressing concern over Facebook and Instagram account takeovers.

The post State AGs Send Letter to Meta Asking It to Take ‘Immediate Action’ on User Account Takeovers appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: State AGs Send Letter to Meta Asking It to Take ‘Immediate Action’ on User Account Takeovers

description:
An upgraded ESC security chip makes the firmware of several HP business PCs resilient to quantum computer attacks.

The post Quantum Attack Protection Added to HP Business PCs appeared first on SecurityWeek.
title: Quantum Attack Protection Added to HP Business PCs
